title: Farm value per liter of maple syrup in Ontario 2000 to 2018
yAxis: Farm value per liter in Canadian dollars
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Farm value per liter in Canadian dollars, with a total of 19 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2010 to 2002.
Also, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2016 to 2012.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is slightly positive which exists from 2018 to 2016.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2012 to 2010.
Conversely, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2002 to 2000.
gold: In 2018 , the farm value of maple syrup in Ontario amounted to 11.31 Canadian dollars per liter . The farm gate value of one liter of maple syrup in Ontario has fluctuated over the past eighteen years , having hit a high of 15.59 Canadian dollars in 2015 . The volume of maple syrup produced in Ontario has also varied quite dramatically in the last few years .
